content.description: Thin. Might bring a cam or two but generally well spaced bolts.

Make the first move, then put in a small piece or two before deciding to remain in the crack or hunt for face holds. 

 At the top, move right on hidden sidepulls and a far away right foot (towards the obvious horn), or continue up the dirty slab without protection to top out.
content.protection: Single rack. I wanted a 4, but it is possible with 3s. Rap anchors installed several feet back from topout by the ETCC in 2020.
content.location: Corner of Punk Rock closest to the overhung cracks of Tityos Block.

content.description:
Start on choice of chest high holds, move up then left to the topout on Dark Side of the Moon.

 A low start from the start of The Gargoyle seems possible.

 If this has already been done before, please post the previous route info so I can update it.
Sit start on jug. Work up and right using crack and side pulls. Top out above the crack.

Easy holds down low lead to an odd move to gain the ledge. Standing on the ledge, the move to the top is tall and long. The holds are there, though you might doubt it at first. Anchors on top, within clipping distance.Face bolts replaced May 2020.
content.protection: 3 Bolts to top anchors. Bring long draws for anchors.
content.location: To the left of Redneck Culture, found in the channel away from the overhang of Tityos Block.

content.description: Thin face climbing.  The climb is now dirty from disuse, however, and the route essentially needs an entire cleaning. This one had its bolts chopped and they have not been replaced.
content.protection: Top Rope. There are no anchors, so one will have to be made from above.  This is on the Punk Rock where the original tree access has now died and is untrustworthy.  It is possible to lead the trad crack on the corner nearest the Tityos Block (ship-like block nearby) and then set up a system to get down. I won't suggest systems, but be aware that innovations will be needed to get off the block.   Consider choosing another climb until the Park Service allows for a few bolted anchors again.
content.location: On the corner of the Punk Rock Block opposite corner from the stream.

content.description: Funky dishes and a few sidepulls. Get a stance then head up through the overhang above.
content.location: On the back side of Tityos Block, just to the right of "11c"

content.description: Sit start on the huge jug, mantel into moves on the best pebbles and top out.
content.location: Follow the lower trail approx .4 miles.  Go right around a cluster at the top of the hill.  It will be the back side.

content.description:
Sit start on the lowest shelf, move up to the gargoyle shaped flake, out to the lip crimp, then up on crimps and pebbly pockets.

 If this has already been done before, please post the previous route info so I can update it.

Sit start on incut flake, work up through undercling, slopey pockets, and juggy topout.

 If this has already been done before, please post the previous route info so I can update it.
Obvious crack line. Much of the gear isn't as good as you want but a couple bomber pieces. Use the feet on the right.
content.protection: SIngle rack, bring a 4. Original two bolt anchor, but no quick links.
content.location: Obvious overhanging crack nearest the corner of Tityos Block.

content.description: Start on the low obvious jug, make a few tension requiring moves through some dishes to a sloper rail and fire to a perfect crimp on the lip.  Top out left side.
content.protection: 1 or 2 crashpads will suffice, but more is always easier on long overhangs.
content.location: Take the lower trail to the second obvious redirect.  at the top of the hill turn left between 2 large boulders.   35.865899,-84.892749

content.description: Bouldery moves on slightly overhanging rock. A couple cams could make it less heady (possibly originally a mixed line). Great friction. Rebolted in 2019 by volunteers.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchors with second set of anchors above for top roping.
content.location: The downhill side of Tityos Block.

content.description: This series of boulders, including Punk Rock and Tityos Block, boasts both excellent hard overhung routes and technical face climbs surrounding around a labyrinthian-like narrows area.
